newsitem.title: USA: Conn. delays $6 mln of bonds for schools - paper.
newsitem.headline: Conn. delays $6 mln of bonds for schools - paper.

text.p: Connecticut, which plans to sell almost $162 million of bonds during the week of November 11, has yet to include $6 million of school bonds on the State Bond Commission's agenda, the Hartford Courant said Tuesday.
State school officials said the education department has been asking since August for the issue to be placed on the bond commission's agenda.
The state Deparment of Education this summer awarded 45 schools systems money to wire their classrooms for computers, the paper said.

Gov. John Rowland is under pressure to keep under this year's bonding cap of $500 million, the paper said. The paper quoted a spokeswoman for the governor as saying no decision had been made yet for the commission's December meeting. She added Rowland was "very supportive" of the computer program for schools.
